REVIEW COMPLETE - RECOMMEND FOR APPROVAL

**Frontmatter Verification:**
- title: 'Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Governance' - VERIFIED
- revision_summary: 'CR-051: Add Section 7.4 CR Closure Prerequisite requiring RS/RTM EFFECTIVE before CR closure' - VERIFIED (references authorizing CR)

2. RTM must be EFFECTIVE before CR post-review - VERIFIED (line 250)
3. Rationale paragraph explaining requirement - VERIFIED (lines 252-253)
4. Applicability note for all code CRs - VERIFIED (lines 254-255)

**Section Numbering:**
- 7.3 Qualification is Not a Document - unchanged
- 7.4 CR Closure Prerequisite - NEW
- Section 8 and 9 - unchanged

Section numbering is correct and document structure is consistent.

**Content Match:** New section content matches CR-051 Section 5.1 exactly.

**Placeholder Check:** No TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX found.
**Typos/Errors:** None found.
**Formatting:** Consistent throughout.

RECOMMENDATION: Approve. SOP-006 correctly implements INV-010 CAPA-001.

REVIEW: RECOMMEND

Frontmatter verified:
- title: "Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Governance" (unchanged)
- revision_summary: "CR-083: Clarify qualified commit source (7.2) and add explicit merge gate (7.4)" (references CR ID, descriptive)

Structure: All sections present and correctly numbered. No new sections added; changes are additions within existing Sections 7.2 and 7.4.

Placeholder check: No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found.

Scope compliance: Changes confined to Sections 7.2 and 7.4 as authorized by CR-083 EI-2. All other sections (1-6, 7.1, 7.3, 8-9) are unchanged from effective. No scope creep.

Section 7.2 changes verified:
- New paragraph added defining the qualified commit as an execution branch commit verified by CI, preserved on main via merge commit (--no-ff), with explicit statement that the RTM references the execution branch hash, not the merge commit hash.
- Cross-reference to "SOP-005 Section 7.1" is valid.
- Consistent with SOP-005 Section 7.1.2 definition.

Section 7.4 changes verified:
- New requirement 3 added: "Code changes shall not be merged to the main branch until both the RS and RTM are EFFECTIVE"
- Expanded rationale explaining the merge gate is distinct from the post-review gate.
- Cross-reference to "SOP-005 Section 7.1.3 for merge type requirements" is valid.
- New paragraph clarifies the temporal ordering: merge happens after RS/RTM approval but before post-review routing.

Formatting: No inconsistencies found. The effective SOP-006 does not use em-dashes, so the double-hyphen style in new text introduces no conflict.

Cross-consistency: Merge type, qualified commit definition, and merge gate statements are consistent with SOP-005 draft and TEMPLATE-CR draft (verified in cross-document check).
